result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Streich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael John Streich in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF236, 14CF125, 13CF197 & 13CM239 called - 
13CF178 - Counts 2 - 4 DRI - Plea no contest to count 1
13CM239 - Plea no contest
15CF236, 14CF125, 13CF197 all counts DRI - 
Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguements by Dunphy/Koppelman/Court to sentencing - 
Sentence withheld - 24 months probation - AODA and follow through with recommended treatment - No alcohol - No taverns - Counseling as recommended by Agent - Court Costs each count - Court appointed attorney fees - (60 days jail stayed to be used at the discretion of Probation Agent for rules violations) - Post conviction rights given
for hearing on admission of prior convictions for impeachment purposes relative to the defendant - state
Regarding fees and expenses and order for Payment

Defendant Michael John Streich in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13CF197, 14CF125 also called - Set for scheduling  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael John Streich in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 13CF197, 13CM239, 14CF125 - Statements by Koppelman - Wedemeyer is the GAL in the Guardianship case -  Statements by Dunphy - Court does not feel there is a need for mental health eval and will not make arrangements to do so  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Michael John Streich in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Donald J. Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Kelly Streich (Guardian) also appears - Statements by Koppelman - Statements by Dunphy - No issue with making the information on the Comp Eval assessable to the State  - Court feels another comp eval should be done by Dr. Benson due to conflicting results of findings - Payment of exam will be addressed at a different time - A release to be signed - Ms. Tate's records to be released to Dr. Benson - Records to be released to DA and Dr. Galli - Koppelman to prepare order
Motion hearing on July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
from Attorney Koppelman - Requesting adjournment due to previous calendar conflicts - Granted
Approved - To pay $70 per month commencing 7/1/14
